Line 91: Line 91:  
{{cquote|In fact, one of the, maybe the most, elementary of moral principles is that of universality, that is, If something's right for me, it's right for you; if it's wrong for you, it's wrong for me. Any moral code that is even worth looking at has that at its core somehow.}}
 
{{cquote|In fact, one of the, maybe the most, elementary of moral principles is that of universality, that is, If something's right for me, it's right for you; if it's wrong for you, it's wrong for me. Any moral code that is even worth looking at has that at its core somehow.}}

==Morality and religion==
+
==Morality and Religion==
 
{{See also|Divine command theory|Morality without religion|Secular ethics}}
 
{{See also|Divine command theory|Morality without religion|Secular ethics}}
 
Many religions provide moral guidelines for their followers. They believe that the divine has instructed them with a way to live and that following these rules will lead to good social structure, and closer communion with the divine.
